Negotiating with families to stop child/ early marriges.

collecting information on local issues and submtting application or representing the issue at panchayat, BDO, police, ASHA, AWW; enable access of services to girls/ women or households in the area; improvement in civic amenities, write about community issues, undertake campaigns and so on)

 (Engagement means some or all of these- they show signs of being sensitive about gender justice, participate in community social action projects, refer violence/abuse cases, participate in household work etc)
Quarterly Interface meeting with adolescent clubs and CSGs in all villages..
Training of 20 persons (volunteers and staff) on baseline data collection at 30 villages of 16 panchayat
Training on SRHR to TOTs ( 5 batches at Kadaladi Block)
Training on mobilisation and engagement for cluster level and apex body of federation members (60 members trained)
Organizing 2015 adolescent girls age clubs (11 to14 and 15 to 19) who are vulnerable to working in textile mills and fish processing units in to 60 clubs in 30 project villages
Facilitate participatory social, resource, access and control maps to understand the factors for school drops out,  early and forced marriage, in 30 villages.
1000 AG to participate to learn painting and drawing, Tamil Folk arts, story telling, reading skills, theatre, etc.,
Run life skill education workshop with  60 clubs covering all adolescent girls
Celebration of important days through traditional folk arts and cultural activities in 30 villages. (4 events per village e.g.National Girls child day, Education day etc)
TOT on CFAM to 120 peer leaders (30 leaders/batch/year) in Kadaladi block
Training by Peer leaders on CFAM to club members
Exposure visit for peer leaders to interview stakeholders (Govt allied depts - CWC, JJB, Court,AHTU etc)
Peer leaders presenting action plan with stakeholders.
Representation of peer leaders at State or National level youth forums/events (support allowance for ~20-25 peer leaders)
Organise 30 Community Support Groups (CSG), support 30 CSGs to maintain a Adolescent Girls's register at the local level.
Travel support for CSG representatives and peer leaders to place demands at district authorities.
Young father sensitization program for 900 young married couples of 30 villages to understand the gender equality and eliminate domestic violences and take responsibilities in reproductive role.
Identify drop out Adolescent Girls for mainstreaming back to school through financial support from CSG. (grade 6 onwards)
Trainings on importance of girl Adolescent Girls’s education and gender equality to 300 parents and CSG members.
Training to 300 CSG members on RTE, child labor Act, Child marriage prevention Act, UNCRC and Child rights.
Training to 420 school teachers of 21 schools to promote adolescent friendly schools and break the gender barrier to achieve indicators developed for the purpose in 30 villages
Interface meetings with Adolescent girls, parents and education department members (150 members/meet) on importance of education schemes and importance of girl’s education. in Y2 and Y3

Consultation meetings with 25 education department members (Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan - SSA; Block Education Officer -BEO; District Education Officer - DEO; Chief Education Officer -CEO and School Cluster level in charges) in Y2 and Y3
Establishing child protection policy display board at 13 Higher Secondary School, 8 High schools.
Establish Bio Intensive Gardening (BIG) to address the anaemic conditions of adolescent girls.
